text: Francisco Dueñas Díaz (3 December 1810 – 4 March 1884) was a Salvadorean politician and member of the Conservative Party who served as President of El Salvador from: *3 May 1851 – 30 January 1852 in acting capacity *1 February 1852 – 1 February 1854 *1–12 February 1856 in acting capacity *26 October 1863 – 15 April 1871. He was "an ardent defender of the clerical interests. Dueñas at one time had taken the vows as a Dominican, but when the convents were closed in 1829, he left the cloister and secured a papal dispensation." Under his leadership, "the clerical party was in the ascendancy and El Salvador experienced a far-reaching Conservative reaction."J. Lloyd Mecham, Church and State in Latin America (University of North Carolina Press, 1966), p. 324 ==References== Category:Presidents of El Salvador Category:Vice Presidents of El Salvador Category:1810 births Category:1884 deaths Category:People from San Salvador Category:19th-century Salvadoran people
title: Francisco Dueñas
